intro: Amphilophium glanduliferum, commonly known as the glandular amphilophium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with glandular dots, which contribute to its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
